medical_history.chief_complaint: Intermittent right lower quadrant pain, anorexia, and fevers.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient presented with 10 days of intermittent right lower quadrant pain that was exacerbated by movement and radiated circumferentially. Associated symptoms includes myalgia, malaise, fever up to 102.2Â°F, chills, night sweats, lightheadedness, nausea, and one episode of vomiting 8 days ago. Patient reports passing flatus.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Psoriasis, hypertension (htn), hyperlipidemia (hld), adrenal gland pathology being worked up by PCP, 2 spontaneous vaginal deliveries (SVD), varicose vein removal x2, tonsillectomy.
medical_history.family_history: Sister deceased from breast cancer, mother deceased from melanoma with a history of atrial fibrillation (afib), father deceased from congestive heart failure (CHF) with a history of afib, uncle with diabetes mellitus type I (DMI).
